verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.comment: Introduction to the chapter; direct speech from God to Moses and Aaron.

verses.text: Speak to the Israelites and say to them: Any man who has a discharge from his body, his discharge makes him unclean.
verses.comment: ‘Discharge’ here refers to an abnormal bodily flow, likely genitourinary.

verses.text: Whether the discharge flows from his body or is blocked up, it is still his uncleanness.
verses.comment: This verse refers both to constant and interrupted discharges.

verses.text: Every bed that the man with the discharge lies on will be unclean, and everything he sits on will be unclean.
verses.comment: Objects touched by the unclean person also become unclean.

verses.text: Anyone who touches his bed must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Ritual impurity lasts until evening after washing.

verses.text: Whoever sits on anything the man with the discharge sat on must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Physical contact with objects provokes ritual impurity.

verses.text: Whoever touches the body of the man with the discharge must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Direct contact brings uncleanness.

verses.text: If the man with the discharge spits on someone who is clean, that person must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Uncleanness transferred even by bodily fluid such as spit.

verses.text: Every saddle that the man with the discharge rides on will be unclean.
verses.comment: Extends to objects used during travel.

verses.text: Anyone who touches anything that was under him will be unclean until evening. Whoever carries those things must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Carrying unclean objects intensifies ritual impurity.

verses.text: If anyone the man with the discharge touches has not first washed his hands in water, that person must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Handwashing required to prevent ritual impurity.

verses.text: Any clay vessel that the man with the discharge touches must be broken, and every wooden vessel must be rinsed with water.
verses.comment: Clay vessels absorb impurity irreversibly, wood can be purified.

verses.text: When the man with the discharge becomes clean from his discharge, he must count seven days for his cleansing. He must wash his clothes, bathe his body in running water, and will be clean.
verses.comment: Seven days as a period of complete cleansing.

verses.text: On the eighth day he must take two turtledoves or two young pigeons and come before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.
verses.comment: Birds for sin and burnt offerings mark restored ritual purity.

verses.text: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. In this way, the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD for his discharge.
verses.comment: Sin and burnt offerings atone and restore religious status.

verses.text: When a man has an emission of semen, he must wash his whole body with water and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Semen emission creates temporary impurity.

verses.text: Every garment or leather that has semen on it must be washed with water and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: All materials in contact must be washed.

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen, they must both bathe in water and be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Coitus results in ritual impurity for both partners until evening.

verses.text: When a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she will be in her menstrual impurity for seven days. Whoever touches her will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Menstrual impurity lasts seven days; contact brings uncleanness.

verses.text: Everything she lies on during her impurity will be unclean, and everything she sits on will be unclean.
verses.comment: Objects touched during impurity also become unclean.

verses.text: Whoever touches her bed must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Washing is required after touching unclean objects.

verses.text: Anyone who touches any object she sits on must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Restates rules for contact with objects.

verses.text: Whether he touches something on the bed or something she sat on, he will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Extends to indirect contact.

verses.text: If a man lies with her and her menstrual impurity touches him, he will be unclean for seven days, and every bed he lies on will be unclean.
verses.comment: Sexual contact during menstruation brings seven days of impurity.

verses.text: If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days, not during her menstrual period, or if the discharge continues past her usual time, she will be unclean as long as she has the discharge, as she is during her menstrual period.
verses.comment: Refers to chronic or abnormal bleeding, not regular menses.

verses.text: Any bed she lies on during the time of her discharge will be as during her menstrual impurity, and everything she sits on will be unclean, as during her impurity.
verses.comment: Abnormal discharge treated like menstruation for impurity.

verses.text: Anyone who touches them will be unclean; he must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.comment: Emphasizes ritual treatment of contact.

verses.text: Once she is clean from her discharge, she must count seven days, and after that she will be clean.
verses.comment: Seven-day period mirrors cleansing for the man.

verses.text: On the eighth day she must take two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.comment: Same offering requirement as for men with a discharge.

verses.text: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. In this way, the priest shall make atonement for her before the LORD for her discharge.
verses.comment: Parallel atonement for women.

verses.text: You must keep the Israelites separate from their uncleanness, so they do not die in their uncleanness by defiling my tabernacle which is among them.
verses.comment: Uncleanness endangers the tabernacle and the people's lives.

verses.text: This is the law for the man with a discharge, for anyone who has an emission of semen causing uncleanness,
verses.comment: Summary statement for male impurity.

verses.text: for the woman with a discharge, whether from her body or her menstrual impurity, and for any man or woman who lies with someone who is unclean.
verses.comment: Final summary statement includes all cases.
